text:
3rd Avenue, at the S. E. corner of 27th Street. These buildings were razed later in the year to make possible the widening of the avenue and its incorporation into the Belt Parkway. The tracks are on Third Avenue.

P. L. Sperr

July 21, 1940
views 1,

view 2: Neg. No A-968

view - shows Nos. 253-51 Third Avenue, adjoining the N. E. corner of 25th Street.

3rd Avenue, at the S. E. corner of 27th Street. These buildings were razed later in the year to make possible the widening of the avenue and its incorporation into the Belt Parkway. The tracks are on Third Avenue.

P. L. Sperr

July 21, 1940
views 1,

view 2: Neg. No A-968

view - shows Nos. 253-51 Third Avenue, adjoining the N. E. corner of 25th Street.

27th Street, north side, east from Third Avenue. The houses in the foreground were later torn down for the construction of Gowanus Parkway, a link in the Belt Parkway system. View 2 shows the same site after the corner buildings were razed. Note the W. P. A. office on the left.

View 1: July 21, 1940
View 2: October 18, 1940
View 3: April 21, 1941

P. L. Sperr
